headline: Ohio Redistricting Commission running short on time for new legislative maps
sentences: A federal court is considering whether to allow the May 3 election to go forward using maps supported by Republicans that have already been ruled unconstitutional by the Ohio Supreme Court.
Two outside mapmakers have been working for days on legislative maps but so far, members of the Ohio Redistricting Commission have not liked what they’ve seen.
Today is the deadline for the Ohio Redistricting Commission to pass a fourth set of legislative maps to satisfy the Ohio Supreme Court.
DeWine wouldn’t say if he would vote for the maps if a plan is presented today.
This is the first time the commission has used mapmakers to come up with maps.
Mike DeWine says he thinks the maps should be passed by midnight tonight.
The court order does not provide for a continuance of that time.
So the goal has to still be to get a map," DeWine says.
“The court order says we are supposed to approve a map.
To see more, visit The Statehouse News Bureau.
